required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Accuracy of 3DPrinted Windowed Bracket- Positioning Guide Compared To Thermoformed Indirect Bonding Tray
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Accuracy of 3DPrinted Windowed Bracket- Positioning Guide Compared To Thermoformed Transfer Tray For Orthodontic Indirect Bonding A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: this study was aimed to evaluate of accuracy of 3DPrinted windowed Bracket- Positioning Guide in compare to Thermoformed Transfer Tray For Orthodontic Indirect Bonding

primary_outcome.measure: accuracy of 3D printed transfer tray with windows& conventional thermoformed transfer tray
primary_outcome.description: using digital measurements on 3 shape software in mm degrees

secondary_outcome.description: counting after bonding number of brackets or tubes failed immediately

clinical_study.condition: Inaccurate Transfer and Bond Failure of Conventional Indirect Bonding Tray
Accuracy of Bracket Transfer and Bond Failure Rate of Digitally Printed Transfer Tray With Windows and Conventional Thermoformed Transfer Tray

intervention.description: 3 D printed tray with windows for accurate positioning of brackets

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age: above 13 years.
2. Complete set of permanent teeth including second molar.
3. No sex predilection.
4. Class I Mild to moderate crowding (4-6 mm).
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Surface enamel defect that compromise bonding
2. No or poor patient's compliance.
3. Psychological problems.
4. Pathology at the site of intervention.
5. Insufficient crown height that contradicts bonding of brackets.
6. Labial and buccal Restorations.
7. Poor oral hygiene.
8. Severely rotated teeth
